an4.3:0.3: 3. The First Discourse on the Uprooted
an4.3:1.1: “Monks, a foolish and dimwitted person who lacks integrity and is endowed with four qualities carries themselves around uprooted and beat up. They are blamable and found blameworthy by those who know. And they create much bane.
an4.3:1.3: Without having keenly appraised and thoroughly probed, they speak praise one worthy of criticism.
an4.3:1.4: Without having keenly appraised and thoroughly probed, they criticize one worthy of praise.
an4.3:1.5: Without having keenly appraised and thoroughly probed, they are confident about sketchy matters.
